A cookie is a small piece of text sent to your browser by a website you visit. Cookies enhance the user experience, for example it helps the website to remember information about your visit, like your preferred language and other settings. Without cookies, using the web would be a much more frustrating experience. Why is this website using cookies? Information of logged in user is kept in a cookie. Without this cookie, user would need to input credentials on every page view when browsing pages where authorization is required. Website will use login after website session is expired. When you confirm notification about cookies, that’s also saved to a cookie. Without this cookie, same notification would be visible in every page load. Start page List Instructions Link Return Service User Guidelines General search functions With the application form of the start page, you can apply for metal companies, objects and services either local/service or free phrase search. For example, if you enter the local area of the “river” and the context into the field of the “bael pillar” you will get a list of metal companies or regions where the term “river” is described and the teräel bars are selected. The name of the metal company or region may be in bent form; For example, "Karimäki" may be in the directory under the name "Karimäki metal area". This should be taken into consideration when selecting the application. If you’re looking for the word “carimäki”, you might not find the item if it’s written in the longer form mentioned above. Instead, you should apply for a partial word “carima” because that part of the word is found in all forms of bending. This should be remembered if you are experiencing difficulties looking for objects. The name must always be written. Start by clicking the Search button. If there is a lot of search results, they will be divided into pages, so a list of page numbers will appear on the right. From the search results list, you can view the data of each item by clicking on its name. Search results The results of the Location/Se.ce Search also include companies, addresses or municipalities whose activity or market area covers the e. terms defined in the search. For example, you’re looking for metal companies in your municipality of residence and you’ll also get search results from companies that may be domiciled elsewhere but are also available in the location you apply. You can limit the search results to the nearby area you entered, choosing a selection box. A free application search seeks search phrases from the company’s name, industry, address, contact, description and context data and may easily provide unne.ary search results. Alphabetical lists Instead of searching, you can find a metal company or service company using our list. Choose a letter, then you can browse the location you’re looking for on the numbered pages. There is also an alphabetical list of the municipalities of Finland. Missing information If you notice that an essential metal company is missing from our directory, or if there are errors in the report, you can contact the feedback page. https://4maint.wordpress.com/.https://4maint.wordpress.com/background-: 4MAINT Skip to Content 4MAINT Mobile Maintenance The App Background Technology Company News Contact Background Factories are usually run by enterprise resource planning (ERP) software.es. They cover everything from factorywarehouse catalogues to computerized maintenance management systems. These systems can overwhelm the users with their seemingly complicated interfaces that can lead to incorrect input into the system. It can also make finding pocket relevant information difficult. Operational maintenance has increased in modern factories and our application is a tool to satisfy that growing need. In the factory environment the operators carry out visual it tours to the production lines to check that everything is working like it should. 4Maint system relies on these visualizations and makes it more efficient to collect and analyze the data that they provide. This is the first time that we can collect tacit data from the factory maintenance. The 4Maint app creates a short cut to receive and update pocket relevant information to and from the CMMS backend systems. Through our 4Maint mobile application the maintenance worker has real-time access to the measurement data already available through various sensors and process control systems. Allowing for on-field analysis of hardware behavior based on both.al data and measurement data. This gives operators and the operating maintenance staff a lot better opportunity evaluate, act and react to different situations and risks in the production line such as the risks of unscheduled downtimes. Throughlessreless portable sensors connected to the mobile device, the 4Maint app can collect on-field data from hardware that are outside the measurement systems of the production line. This data can be utilized to corroborate possible maintenance findings and.s on the field. All measurement data will be displayed in user . continent. Reducing the risk misinterpretation that could lead to adverse effects. Context of the new series: Contacts: Container Container Container Container Container Contacts and Service M ACE C Series C Series BC RELIABILITY Reference Case L-series Flexible alternating current transmission systems, FACTS, used to increase power transfer capability and improve controllability in a network. Adwatec provides proven solutions for power grid applications based on the highest reliability and power requirements. The L series cooling stations’ typical cooling capacity ranges from 100 to 10,000 kW and coolant flow between 100 and 10,000 litres per minute. They are used all around the world in SVCs and STATCOMs, and with a complete duplicated control system, are well.ed for HVDC use. For micro grid applications, we provide smaller systems that can be built inside a container. Made for Every Project We tailor the power grid cooling solutions and their scopes individually for each project to meet your specific needs. By customizing our ourar cooling stations, we are able to execute the projects promptly and .iciently. Our experts optimize the pumps, piping and cooler design, and draw from our extensive list of instrumentation and red.ancy solution to design a comprehensive solution that complies with the requirements and hits the performance targets. Cooling you can trust Using the correct materials and meticulous as.y by our experienced and skilled professionals enable a long lifespan for our solutions. Before shipping the stations to our customers' ties, we test each of their functions. All tests are carried out out in.nce with common industrial practice in order to demonstrate compliance with the specification. We are available 24/7 for technical support. Any questions? Please contact our Power grid experts to see how we can help with your project. ACE C Series C series series BCSC COOOLING APPLICATIONS The L series cooling stations are designed for the most demanding de-ionized water cooling systems – suitable for Static Var Compensators (SVC), STATCOMs, HVDC and power electronics applications, where medium and high voltages are used. L series covers a large range of coolant flows and cooling power to meet application requirements. A wide variety of. is available for added reliability, availability and maintainability. Download data sheet contact us Key features Typical cooling capacity from 200 kW to 3 MW Red ant pumps as a standard de-ionizing circuit for low conductivity of water to water heat exchanger Easy maintenance access Both standard and duplicated control systems available Wide selection of communication protocols to customer system Leakage detection system and amongic fill up among optional functions Turnkey delivery with interconnecting piping and installation services The cooling system project consists of design, manufacturing, testing and delivery of equipment. The typical delivery scope includes complete and tested cooling station, heat exchanger and interconnecting piping with project documentation. Adwatec professionals can take part in site activities in the form of site supervision and commissioning services. L series cooling systems can be tailored to a variety of applications with customer specific needs. ACE C Series C Series C Series B Series do you want to grow with us into a global sales professional in the marine industry? Adwatec is now looking for a new junior sales engineer. Our experienced sales managers work with international shipping and industrial customers. The team is growing! We are in a strong growth phase due to global megatrends – zerification, zero-emission, digitalization and sustainability. Your customer base: hy d and fully electric vessels, cruise ships, ferries, ro-ro ferries, gas tankers, river cruise ships, offshore supply vessels, offshore windmill vessels, PSV, WPIV, tugs, co  guard vessels, offshore oil rigs, tidal energy solutions, lifting vessels, super luxury yachts, ROV, BOG and hydrogen production! As a sales engineer, you will get to know your pocket and the company extensively during the spring and summer. Our goal is that in addition to sales, you will see the activities of the production and customer care team and, if desired, get to know the needs of customers at marine fairs such as Electric & Hy.d Amsterdam, Navalia Spain and/or the world’s largest marine fair, SMM Hamburg. You will assist current sales managers and at the same time take control of your future customer segment. The main job description is the management of international customer relationships and sales channels, as well as new customer acquis.. Practical pockets include daily communication with our customers and partners, identifying customer needs and selecting and ifyifying products to needs, as well as calculating/making. You don’t work alone, you have the support of our own sales managers and technical team. You may be the person we are looking for if you already have some previous experience in, for example, sales, technical interface or customer projects. You have a sales attitude and want to develop your skills in international sales. You will work with an open and positive attitude and teamwork skills. The position is permanent and full-time. Your permanent office is a completely new state-of-). office and factory building in Kaukajä)., Tampere. We silver that you will be able to start in the position as soon as possible, during spring 2024. Adwatec: An excellent opportunity for professional growth and competence development, as well as the opportunity to progress, for example, to an international regional sales manager support from a highly experienced sales team, where you get to travel and network network The to grow into a world class professional in sales comprehensive employee benefits: occupational health, sports/culture vou,s, good colleagues you are expected to: Appropriate commercial or technical travel readiness Good Finnish and English language skills Above all, a brisk attitude and the ability to execute In, the following are considered advantages: Other language skills, e.g. French, German or Spanish previous applicable experience in sales or customer cooperation Expertise in ERP and CRM information systems, as well as good information skills Interested. Send your CV and motivation letter in PDF format by 30.4.2024 at the latest to You can ask about this position by calling Ismo Lehtonen (Sales and Marketing Director), 040-669 2220. You can best reach lust on 12 April 2024 at 10-15 and on 19 April 2024 at 10-15. When a claim is found, we will proceed quickly, so you should act. ———————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————— — ——————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————————— Adwatec knows the power of cooling. ACE C Series C Series BCSC grid, industry and marine 54 countries Deliveries worldwide over 536 ships use Adwatec cooling for propul. drives 20 years of Adwatec cooling station deliveries how how we serve your business Adwatec Ltd Adwatec is a water technology company serving customers in Marine, Electrical Grid, Heavy Industry, and other sectors globally. With over two decades of experience in advanced water cooling for power electronics and a strong focus on R&D, we provide our customers proven, state-of-the-. solutions today and in the future. Adwatec Ltd is part of Helkama Emotor Group that employs 400 professionals worldwide. The company is headquartered in Finland. Committed to your success, our customers trust us to deliver high-quality cooling solutions quickly and problem-free. We work hard every day to live up to that trust. Our commitment is what sets us apart. What we promise, we keep. We know cooling Having worked in water technology for almost 20 years, we can honestly say we know our business. Our solutions are well-proven in use – we have successfully delivered thousands of water cooling stations around the world for customers working in various industries. We are specialized solely in cooling. It means our skilled professionals can focus on designing and innovation the most efficient, reliable and technically advanced water cooling solutions in the market. Any questions? The C series stations can be delivered as open frame solutions or installed into a standard cabinet. Space-saving design and the materials used in their construction make them  reliable reliable in use. They are easily. with cooling circuits and accessible for maintenance due to movable cooling.e. Modular design and various. related to heat exchanger, control system and pumps ensure the right solution with cooling power and flow rate. Adwatec has a DNV type certificate for C-series liquid cooling stations. Download data sheet contact us Key features Cooling capacity up to 300 kW Coolant flow up to 750 l/min Minimum footprint required – typical installation is inside a 600 mm cabinet Automatic de-aeration Easy to  ate with the cooling circuit F easy and easy commissioning (automatic de-aeration and visual coolant level indication) Stainless Inel industrial pumps and carefully selected materials ensure a long and reliable operation product selection with Configurator Introduction video to unique features of Adwatec’s C-series cooling station: The commissioning of a water cooling station: Operation the cooling stations circulate coolant between power electronics and a heat exchanger. A three-way valve is used to ensure constant temperature and to avoid condensation in power electronics. ACE C Series C Series C Series BCSC density is a key metric in electrical engineering that indicates the concentration of power within a given volume. This measure is critical in comparing the efficiency of a system’s power or capacity to its size or volume, thereby optimizing performance and design efficiency. As ships become larger and more sophisticated, the power density of their machinery and equipment increases. The trend towards higher power density Over the past few decades, the power density of most machinery and equipment has increased, a trend driven by technological advances in a number of areas explains this. Two of the most important are the following:.ances in materials have played a critical role in increasing the power density of machinery and equipment. Innovations have led to lighter and stronger composites and met., such as advanced carbon fibre composites and high-strength, lightweight aluminium and ti.ium alloys. These developments make it possible to create lighter components that can withstand higher loads. In.ttery technology, advances in lithium-ion and other advanced chemistries significantly increase energy density. Improvements in semiconductor technology and electronics have also been instrumental in increasing power density. Theturiaturisation of transistors and other electronic components in line with Moore's Law (i.e. the number of transistors on an an circuit doubles every two years) has led to a dramatic increase in the computing power that can be accommodated in a given volume. This trend towards smaller component sizes has enabled the development of more compact devices that not only offer enhanced functionality but also operate with greater efficiency. Adwatec Water Cooling Systems is best,ed for high power density devices machines or equipment. Several key factors explain the greater effectiveness of water cooling in such situations: Water has a higher specific heat capacity than air, allowing it to absorb more heat before its temperature rises. This characteristic is especially advantageous for handling the considerable heat generated by high power density equipment, as it can a significantorb a significant amount of heat before cooling. Water has a higher thermal conductivity than air, allowing it to transfer heat faster and more effectively. This superior heat transfer capability allows water cooling systems to respond more quickly and efficiently to the heat generated by high power density equipment, thereby preventing overheating. Due to its high thermal capacity and conductivity, water can a.orb more heat per unit volume than air. This property equipments the design of compact cooling systems that are ideal for integration into high power density equipment where space is limited. As a result, water cooling systems efficiently support optimum performance without the need for bulky external cooling configurations. Water cooling systems can be tailored to deliver cooling where it is most needed. By placing cooling lines or heat exchangers close to heat-generating hotspots, especially in high power-density configurations, they can effectively manage the intense heat generated by specific components. This targeted cooling approach improves system efficiency and prevents localised overheating. As power density and associated heat generation increases, the effectiveness of air cooling systems tends to fall. These systems must circulate larger volumes of air or significantly increase airflow to dissipate the additional heat, which can result in increased noise and reduced energy efficiency. In contrast, water cooling systems are more efficient at handling higher heat loads without significantly increasing operating costs or noise levels. How Does Water Cooling Work? Using water to remove heat from a system is a relatively simple mechanism. First, the central element of a water cooling system is the heat source, which is fitted with heat sinks or cooling elements designed to dissipate the heat generated into a cooling medium. By increasing the surface in contact with the water, these heat sinks improve the efficiency of the heat transfer process. Second, cold water is pumped through a series of pipes within the system. As it passes through or over the heat sinks, it absor. heat from the heat source. This heated water must then be cooled to effectively maintain the continuous cooling cycle. Third, the heated water is discharged from the system to a heat exchanger where it can be cooled. There are two main types of heat exchanger used in such installations: Water-to-water heat exchangers: In this system, heated water flows through pipes or coils exchangemersed in a cooler water.th. The cooler water ex.s heat from the heated stream without mixing. Water-to-air coolers: In this arrangement, the heated water circulates through coils or plates exposed to the air. Either fans or natural air currents are used to dissipate the heat by blowing cooler air over these surfaces. What are the main features of Adwatec Water Cooling Systems? The key features outlined for the Adwatec water cooling system provide a detailed summary of its capabilities, design advantages and ease of use. Below is a breakdown of each feature and the benefits they provide: Cooling capacity up to 300 kW The maximum heat).al capacity of the system expressed in kilowatts (kW). With a heat.al capacity of up to 300 kW, this system can handle significant heat loads, which is ideal for high demand environments such as marine applications. This (300kW) relates to our standard portfolio, but bigger systems are also available. Coolant flow rate up to 750 l/min Highlights the peak coolant flow rate of the system, measured in litres per minute (l/min). A flow rate of 750 l/min.s the rapid circulation of a significant volume of coolant utilize the system, which is essential for efficient heat.al. Relates to our standard portfolio, but bigger systems are also available. Minimum footprint - typical installation is in a 600 x 600 mm cabinet The compact design of the cooling system is sized to fit into a 600 x 600 mm cabinet. Its Itimal footprint is especially.ed to environments where space is at a premium, allowing optimum use of available space while still providing robust cooling performance. Automatic de-airing is the process ofering air from the coolant, which is critical because air pockets can reduce efficiency and cause long-term damage to the cooling system. By keeping the coolant free of air, maintenanceic venting streamlines maintenance and increases system reliability. Easy to .ate into the cooling circuit: This feature indicates that the system has been designed for compatibility, making it easy to .ate into existing cooling circuits. This benefit is especially useful in retrofit scenarios or when expanding existing systems. Quick and easy commissioning: All of the above features allow for quick and easy commissioning. Commissioning time and effort by eliminating manual processes, and the visual coolant level indicators provide an easy method of monitoring and adjusting coolant levels to maintain optimum system efficiency. Stainless industrialel industrial pumps and carefully selected materials: The use of stainless.el for the industrial pumps and high quality materials for other system components increases durability and reliability. Stainless superel’s superior super to corro  and wear is critical for a cooling system that frequently interacts with a variety of coolers. These features combine to create a well-designed water cooling system that provides efficient, reliable and high performance cooling in a compact and manageable package. This system is especially well.ed to marine environments, where both performance and space efficiency are essential. Pablo Rodas-M.ini holds a PhD and an MSc from Queen Mary and Westfield College. Dis.: Pablo Rodas-M.ini is a Contri.or to Adwatec. In traditional bladder tank system the de-airing may take days and the remaining air in the system may cause trouble even longer. The tank operating principle makes it simple and fast to de-air the system. With open expan. tank it is possible to collect the remaining air. While keeping the pump running small part of the coolant flow is leading to the tank where small air bubbles have enough time to separate from the coolant. This is a very effective method to get the system de-aered. Practically it takes only one or few hours to get the system de-aered instead of several days. Please click the button below to gain access to a test report. Tank without bladder lasts longer There is no bladder = no risk for breaking the bladder. Adwatec's expan. tank increases reliability: Coolant level monitoring as standard. Any system leaks can be detected at an early stage. Learn more about reliability any questions? ACE C Series C Series B series the heat. This heat is not good for the electrical components in power electronics system and needs to be removed from the system. There are practically two principal methods to remove the heat from the system. Traditionally air has been used to remove the heat. The process principle is simple: air is circulated or blown through the heat generating system. The heat is practically blown away. Air cooling system requires an air circulation system with ducts and vents, a fan unit to move air and a cooler unit to cool down the heated air before it goes back to circulation. The other alternative to remove the heat is to use water. Here the process is simple as well: the heat source has heat sinks or elements that can be cooled with water. Cold water is circulated to the heat source and heated water is the lead out and cooled with a water-to-water heat exchanger or with a water-to-air cooler. Water cooling system requires a pipesystem, pumpstation and water-to-water heat exhanger or with water-to-air cooler units. There are seven features that separate water cooling from other cooling methods. Learn more below! ACE C Series C Series BCSC NEEDS C-series is a highly flexible water cooling solution designed for demanding marine, OEM and industrial cooling applications. The series gives a new way to optimize your system with selectable heat exchangers, in-coming and out-going pipelines and communication and control.. A modular product structure gives the opportunity to have everything included in one unit or have a de-centralized solution with all key.es installed wherever applicable and available. Thanks to a approach based on unmatched expertise, the latest simulation techniques, exhaus. testing both in the lab and in the field, the result is a foundation of the highest quality and reliability available on the planet. Download Data Sheet Contact Us Key The.es are very small thanks to manifolds used instead of complex pipes. This reduces the number of components used and several operational functions can be combined in one. The construction is marine robust and very reliable. Less components means less risky connections. The expan. tank enables the monitoring of both the amount of liquid and air in the system. As there are no ru.er forgs or bladders in use, the construction lasts practically forever. The expan. tank and Adwatec’s de-aerating concept in a very fast commissioning time—few hours instead of days. Reliability Reliability In marine cooling applications the reliability is something that will never be compromised. Adwatec has delivered several hundred cooling units for vessels fromcctic cold to tropical heat. The experience from this is transferred to this.ar solution and the same reliability is now available for all vessels ranging from smallest to larger. Operation the cooling stations circulate coolant between power electronics and a heat exchanger. A three-way valve is used to ensure constant temperature and to avoid condensation in power electronics. Applications Drive and power electronics in marine, process, oil and gas industries and windmills and shore power. Power Electronics in?tteries and energy storages. Contact our experts for your water cooling needs. ACE C Series C series BCSC cooling stations are small single or double pump solutions for power electronics applications. The stations are designed to be integrated with the customer’s construction as the heart of a cooling system. This “plug and play” station is very easy to install. Contact us Key features Cooling capacity up to 120 kW Coolant flow up to 270l/min The smallest cooling station in the market – cabinet footprint starting from 400 x 600 Snap couplings for electrical connections Heat exchanger optional Copper-free materials F) and easy commissioning (automatic de-aeration and visual coolant level indication) Product selection with configurator Operation The cooling stations circulate coolant between power electronics and a heat exchanger. A three-way valve is used to ensure constant temperature and to avoid condensation in power electronics. Pro , oil and gas industries and windmills power electronics in intteries and energy storages Any questions? Contact our experts for your water cooling needs. Key Benefits of Adwatec's Cooling Solution: High-power cooling in compact size Fing delivery Easy commissioning Ulstein is a modern shipyard that builds vessels for offshore wind, exploration cruise, RoPax, and offshore oil and gas. It recently delivered the world's largest plug-in hy.d vessel, the Color Hy.d, for Color Line. The 160-meter long ferry, se.cing between Sandefjord in Norway andöömstad in Sweden, can accommodate 2,000 passengers and 500 cars. The Challenges and Ob.ives The ground-breaking vessel was to be equipped with four.ttery stacks consisting of several severalttery consists that will offer 5 MWh and can operate for up to 60 minutes at speeds up to 12k. For atterttery-powered vessel of this size, highly effective liquid cooling is a prerequisite. As a Passenger, RoRo Ship, the Color Hy.d is subject to strict safety and quality regulations. It is important that thetterttery remains remain at as.ady temperature as possible. To make sure the cooling is efficient enough for such a large.ttery pack, the cooling stations needed to have a higher coolant flow rate. At the same time, the cooling system pressure was not allowed to rise too much even in case of a leak and an anic closing of the coolant lines in the.ttery system. The dimensions and footprint of the cooling systems are kept as small as possible while maintaining the easy start-up and serviceability. These demands create some special challenges in the system design. The solution Adwatec is experienced in providing cooling solutions for power electronics in marine applications like drives and propul., with dozens of deliveries in vessels receiving all over the world. The Color Hy.d, Adwatec provides two C series water cooling stations, one on both sides of the ship. The stations are specifically designed to the to. conditions at high seas and limited space available in ships. The cooling stations were equipped with two pumps. One is in operation, and in case of a pump failure, the Red.ant pump steps in. The standby pump is automaticallyitched as duty pump every two weeks to ensure both pumps remain functional. To gain a high enough flow rate to supply the right temperature cooling water for the large number oftterttery.s. To control the flow rate and to keep the pressure from rising in case a leak is detected in thettetteries, the stations are equipped with fre.ency converters and a state-of-the-. control system. On-site commissioning support and user training were also included in the delivery. Results, the project, some rather significant modifications were made to the project scope as well as to thetterttery system initial data. Thanks to Adwatec’s agile engineering team and experience in the marine industry, the new requirements were applied without a substantial delivery delay. The cooling system was commissioned on time. The need for electrification of marine vessels is growing. The Pioneering Color Line Project introduces new technology in shipbuilding. The model created in this project will be easy to duplicate in building new hy.d ships. ACE C Series C Series B series in Adwatec applications the reliability is the key. This is also the criteria when designing the product. The design is robust and made for to. marine conditions. All is made with high quality materials and nothing has been saved when it comes to construction. The.ar structure of Adwatec’s products allows us to make complete cooling solutions for applications where there is a limited space available. The block building in our design reduces the number of components used. This means less connection points – less risk for leaks. Unique solutions and life Our expan. tank design is unique in this market. Water and air are in the same tank, not separated like in the traditional designs. There is also an anic bleeding feature that removes the air from the system. Thanks to these unique innovations we can offer the fastest commissioning in the market. As a complete solution provider, we take full responsibility for our customers’ cooling for their entire life cycle. Our comprehensive service portfolio covers customer care from consultation to implementation and full maintenance. Learn more below! Adwatec processes your personal data in.nce with European Data Protection Principles. Data Controller Information: Name: Adwatec Oy Address: Artturintie 14 H, FIN-36220 Kangasala Tel: +358 3 3890860 E-mail: Changes to our privacy policy: Adwatec keeps its privacy policy under regular review and places any updates on this website. This privacy policy was last updated in September 2019. Adwatec's Customer Relationship Management Databases Adwatec Uses Customer Relationship Management (CRM) databases to manage and track our sales and marketing activities. Adwatec’s CRM databases include personal data of our customers’, potential customers’ and other companies’ representatives with whom Adwatec has a business relationship or wants to develop one. Adwatec's CRM databases may also include personal data of Adwatec's customers or end-users who contact Adwatec related to water cooling systems or other equipment under Adwatec's scope as well as personal data related to external stakeho.s Adwatec is interested to contact and provide general information of Adwatec and its business. Collected Personal Data The following information is collected and processed in connection with CRM: name e-mail address fixed mobile faxed phone number addresses possible other information relevant to the business relationship such personal information is later in this Section 2 of the privacy statement referred to as "personal data" and the individuals whose personal data is processed, are referred to as "data subjects". The Purposes and Legal Grounds of the Pro2ing The purpose of Adwatec’s processing of personal data is to. Adwatec’s business, support sales activities, deliveries, maintenance services and invoicing, contact customers for contract management and marketing purposes and otherwise maintain the customer relationship. Adwatec may also use personal data to handle incidents and claims as well as provide assistance as requested by customer. Adwatec may contact the data subjects for conducting customer loyalty surveys. Source(s) of Personal Data and Retention Period The Personal Data has been received from the customers or obtained in connection with their use of Adwatec’s products and services. Personal data may also originate from Adwatec’s representatives based on their business interactions with the data subjects. In certain cases, Adwatec may collect personal data from public registers and other reliable sources. The personal data will be stored as long as needed for the above said purposes. After that, the personal data will be effectively.d or made anonymous. Transfers of Personal Data Adwatec uses the personal data only for its internal business purposes and does not transfer the data to any external parties. Some of the personal data may be accessible and processed by Adwatec’s subsidiaries, subcon.ors and other service providers, to the extent needed in connection with the above said purposes. Adwatec will not transfer any personal data outside Adwatec or its partners and subcon.ors. Adwatec’s Supplier Data Adwatec uses database technology to manage the contact data of Adwatec’s suppliers. This privacy statement provides more information about Adwatec’s personal data processing related to such sourcing and purchasing activities. Collected Personal Data The following information is collected and processed in connection with Supplier Databases: name e-mail address invoicing information possible other information relevant to the business relationship subconconors’ employee name, date of birth, contact information, employment information, qualifications and certifications, other personal information as required by Adwatec’s customers to ensure proper access control and for personal information construction sites such personal information is later in section 3 of this privacy statement referred to as "personal data" and the individuals whose personal data is processed, are referred to as "data subjects". The Purposes and Legal Ground of the Pro2ing The purpose of Adwatec’s processing of personal data is to. Adwatec’s sourcing, purchasing, invoice handling and contract management activities. Adwatec may also use the information to resolve claims or manage incidents and perform due diligence. Adwatec may use the contact information for more general communications and management of the supply relationship, such as sending relevant information of Adwatec’s operations and upcoming events. Source(s) of Personal Data and Retention Period The personal data has been obtained from the suppliers or obtained in connection with their business relationship with Adwatec. Information about workforce is generally obtained from the subcon.or companies who are the persons of such individuals. In certain cases, Adwatec may collect personal data from public registers and other reliable sources. The personal data will be stored as long as needed for the above said purposes. After that, the personal data will be effectively.d or made anonymous. Adwatec uses the personal data only for its internal business purposes and does not transfer the data to any external parties. Adwatec will not transfer any personal data outside Adwatec or its partners and subcon.ors. 3 Adwatec Thispages and Internet Services This section provides you with general information on the processing of your personal data by Adwatec related to this website and other internet services of Adwatec. Adwatec will process your personal data collected through the Site in.nce with this Privacy Statement and applicable laws. Please read this Privacy Statement care if you plan to browse otherwise use the Site. If you do not agree with this Privacy Statement, you must leave the Site. 3.1 Collected Personal Data Generally, you can visit the Site without entering any personal data. The Site is technically divided into separate sections, some of which may require us to collect more personal data of you while some may be used without processing any personal data. When visiting the Site, certain technical and other information is automatically sent by your computer to us. We also collect information about your website usage information by using cookies. Please see the Cookies section of this Privacy Statement for further information. You may be asked to provide personal data (online form or product configurator) to access a service that you have requested. The Purposes and Legal Grounds of the Proinging The purpose of Adwatec’s processing of personal data collected through the Site is to ensure an efficient and secure use of the Site; develop the Site for a better quality and broader scope of services; provide customized services and content recognizing your specific needs and interests; improve our services to you; contact you; conduct and research collect statistics (e.g. what sections of our Site the users and how much time they spend on the Site). Source(s) of Personal Data and Retention Period The Personal Data is received directly from the data subject or obtained in connection with their use of the Site. The personal data will be stored as long as needed for the purposes it has been collected for. After that, the personal data will be effectively.d or made anonymous. 3.4 Cookies On your computer or mobile device to allow us to identify you, provided that you have consented to the placing of cookies on your computer or device for example opt-in function or by way of changing the browser settings. Cookies give Adwatec information on how and when you have used the Site and help Adwatec to improve the Site for a better service. 3.5 Website Analytics Our website uses Google Analytics, a web analysis service provided by Google, Inc. Google Analytics Uses cookies (see chapter above) about your use of the website. The information stored in these cookies, including for example your IP address, time, place and fre.ency of visits stored by Google. This service allows us to analyze how you use our website and to improve our website offering in the future. You can prevent the storage of cookies via the relevant setting in your browser software. For more information please see Google's privacy policy: policies.goo..com/privacy 3.6 Mailchimp Newsletter Adwatec uses MailChimp, a service provided by The Rocket Science Group, to send out our periodic newsletter. Mailchimp allows us to organize and analyze the distribution of our newsletter. When you sign up for our newsletter, your name and email address will be stored on a MailChimp server. When you open one of our newsletters sent through MailChimp, a file in the email (a web beacon) is returned to MailChimp. The file includes information such as when you have opened the newsletter, which links you clicked on, as well as technical information (IP address, browser type and operating system). We use the information to statistically analyze our newsletters and to better serve you in the future. You can unsubscribe from our newsletter at any time by clicking on the unsubscribe link at the end of each newsletter email. For further information, see the Mailchimp privacy policy: 3.7 Transfers of Personal Data Adwatec will not transfer any personal data outside Adwatec. 4 of Data Sub.s’ Rights Data subjects may at any time contact Adwatec and request access to their personal data. Adwatec will at the data subjects’ request rectify or erase any incomplete, inaccurate or outdated personal data. ACE C Series C Series B series water Cooling Solution has never been easy. Adwatec water cooling solution configurator is the first online application that allows you to design your water cooling station easily whenever, wherever. Just fill in the requirements and you will receive the specifications and a detailed offer in your email. We aim to provide our customers with the best of class water cooling solutions. The configurator makes the process of choosing a water cooling solution a breeze: instead of browsing a lengthy datasheet or contacting a salesperson, you can define the specifications with our easy-to-use application. The configurator will choose the most suitable product based on your requirements and show you a sum. Fill in your contact information and the amountry will be sent to you by email. You can also request an offer right away and we’ll come back to you. If you can't find an exact match, you can still use the configurator to deliver your request to us. ACE C Series C Series Series BCR a complete solution provider, we can take full responsibility for our customers’ cooling for their entire life cycle. Our comprehensive service portfolio covers customer care from consultation to implementation and full maintenance. As travelling is impossiblenned or restricted, many things that we have considered normal changed to impossible. FAT in our manufacturing facility and commissioning activites in customer’s premises are among these. tools this year we have created two new tools to cure the situation: Adwatec FAT and Adwatec Remote Site Support Package. Remote FAT Adwatec Remote is a normal FAT but without visitors in our facility. Customer and certifying authority will be present remotely via live video connection. Normal FAT in Adwatec Remote Support Adwatec Remote Support Package is a remote commissioning and maintenance concept for cooling systems. Our technical experts are responsible for content, training and supervision of the commissioning and maintenance. Local staff in client premises do the practical implementation with our expert guidance. In order to ensure success a remote live connection is used with augmented reality enabled tools. Adwatec Remote Site Support Package: Pre-work cooling systems introduction Support documentation and instructions Remote support by means of augmented reality with a world-class third party software solution All are built for the specific site and project. Delivery Services Installation Commissioning and supervision After Sales Services Spare Parts Maintenance, contract-based Field Maintenance and Refurbishment Retrofit Any? The cooling business – what is it really about? Our answer is: it is quite an interesting branch. Air and liquid cooling are used everywhere, but there is not too much cooling information available. It is very difficult to find information of water or liquid cooling applications, products and technology. In this thisc. series we are going to tell what it is all about: what are the applications, where water cooling makes sense and what is important to understand when working with water cooling. We believe that knowledge is power. It is power to us and it is power to our customers and partners. We share what we know and believe that is beneficial to all of us. Do not sell or share my personal information Deny Allow selection Cus ize Allow All Powered by Cookiebot by Usercentrics Benefits of Water Cooling Benefits of Adwatec Products Value of Adwatec Products Applications and References Marine Power grid Batteries and Energy Storages Heavy Industry Container Cooling References Products and Service M ACE C Series C Series B series We set the high standard We ensure our top quality by using only the best materials and first-class European components in our models. Even though our solutions are well-proven in use, we always test our cooling stations thoroughly before sending them to customer's site. That way we can be sure each and every cooling station meets our high standards. All tests are carried out out in.nce with common industrial practice in order to demonstrate compliance with the specification. Factory tests are performed at the testing area of our factory in Kangasala. Adwatec has been awarded a DNV type approval for its C-series liquid cooling station. Type approved C-series liquid cooling stations are accepted for installation on all vessels classed by DNV. Adwatec’s C-series water cooling system is a very narrow and compact system designed for heavy duty use and ro. environments like marine and offshore. Adwatec quality system for design, manufacture and sales of water cooling systems for power electronics is certified with the requirements of the ISO 9001:2015. Our cooling stations have passed several approvals of classification societies, such as Bureau Veritas, Lloyd's Register and DNV. Adwatec received two new certifications: ISO14001 for Environmental Management System and ISO45001 for Occupational Health and Safety. With these two news, we will ensure that we can expect our global partners and all our stakeho.s have for long term quality, health and safety and sustainability. Do not sell or share my personal information Deny Allow selection Cuslicize Allow All Powered by Cookiebot by Usercentrics Benefits of Water Cooling Benefits of Adwatec Products Value of Adwatec Products Applications and References Marine Power grid Batteries and energy storages Heavy Industry Container Cooling References Products and Service M ACE C Series C Series C series BCSC series Article Article Article coolants published in Electric and Hy.d Marine Technology International Magazine April 2024. Click the image for magazine. Water is an excellent medium to remove heat from heat loads like power electronics or.tteries. Too often water or liquid cooling is, claimed to be unreliable or complicated. That doesn’t need to be the case when certain basic matters have been properly considered during the product engineering, manufacturing, and commissioning and everyday use. The focus here is the coolant. Visual coolant level indication required water volume in coolant What coolant to use? The coolant to be used will be specified by the power electronics equipment supplier. Ethylene glycol and propylene glycol can be used as coolants. They alone do not have good corro.. It is necessary to add a corro. inhibitor to the coolant. Some heat transfer fluids already contain inhibitors. Typically, a glycol-based coolant with a concentration of 20-30% offers adequate corro. while while minimizing the reduction of cooling capacity caused by glycol. If an outdoor-installed water-to-air heater is part of the cooling circuit, the glycol concentration will be chosen to the ambient outdoor temperature. How to avoid galvanic corro?? All met. have a galvanic potential. When there is a connection between two met. that have a different galvanic potential, a galvanic circuit is formed and galvanic corro. may find place. The cooling liquid acts as a connector between the met.. Galvanic corro. can be minimized by using non-conductive materials between met. (i.e. plastic or ru.er) and thus disconnecting the galvanic circuit. The recommendation is to use stainless ael and high-grade aluminum (6000-series) and avoid copper and carbon.el-based materials. Copper materials are used, then aluminum shall not be used. There are two types cooling circuits: open systems and closed systems. An open system isn't pressurized and allows free contact with air, while in a closed system the piping is completely airtight and the pipelines are pressurized. Closed-type cooling systems are the most effective way to prevent oxygen diffusion in the coolant and to reduce the risk of corrochemical corro  Adwatec cooling unit designs have a sight glass for easy coolant level Par Particles in the circuit. During the manufacturing and installation process anything can and will happen. Metal and other particles may end up in the power electronics piping, cold plates and cooling system. It is a must to ensure that the system is clean. This can be done by flushing the system. Also later, during the operation when following the maintenance and renewing the coolant, the system flushing is important to remove particles that may have appeared in the system. Small particles cause wear and tear in the cooling system components and may lead to galvanic corro.. They may block tiny cooling channels in cooling elements leading to heat problems as well. Some cooling units have an an window through which the quality of the coolant can be checked. The cooling unit storaging Often the equipment will not be installed and comissioned immediately after manufacture but storaged for later use. Wrong coolant inside the cooling unit or no coolant at all may cause severe damage. Here it is important to ensure that the equipment is stored by the manufacturers. https://www.afstor.com/.https://www.afstor.com/en/info_eng/: Afstor Skip to content +358 400 759 emissions2 Reduces CO2 emissions Homepage Info Product News Cookers in Want to Make a Difference Menu Homepage Info Product News Cookers in use Want to Make a Difference Homepage Info Product News Cookers in Want to Make a Difference Challenge in Africa 840 million people in sub-Saharan Africa don’t have access to electricity. 700 million people are projected to remain without access to electricity by 2050 due to rapid population growth. An open fire is highly energy inefficient and requires a lot of wood. Family of 5 consumes 4000 kg of wood a year producing 6400 kg of CO2. An open fire produces massive air.lution with many dangerous pollutants that penetrate deep into the lungs. Indoor Inlution causes 4 million prem. deaths a year and diseases incl. pneumonia and chronic obstruc. pulmonary disease. Women in developing countries spend an average of 1.4 hours a day collecting firewood and 4 hours cooking. Women are heavily affected by indoor pollutions. Millions of children do not attend or complete primary education - Majority are girls who stay at home to do. labor. Fa ies in suburban areas a big part of their annual income on buying charcoal and lamp oil Unsustainable harvesting of firewood drives deforestation and forest degradation. High rates of deforestation causes: land ero., desertification, famine, destruction of animal habitat andooooding. Deforestation also forces people to leave their homes in search of better opportunities – in Europe and neighbouring countries. Women no longer need to burn wood on an open fire for cooking. Indoor air will be clean and health of those exposed to the fire will be improved. Trees continue to a.orb CO2 from the atmosphere and produce other crucial ecosystem services. Afstor Solar Cooker reduces CO2 emissions equal to 260 000 km driven by a car or 10 Helsinki-Tokio ro. trips by planet during five years. Afstor Solar Cooker reduces workload, creating more time for studying and productive activities with higher returns for women and children who no longer need to waste time on collecting firewood. https://www.afstor.com/.https://www.afstor.com/info_eng/: Afstor Skip to content +358 400 759 emissions2 Reduces CO2 emissions Homepage Info Product News Cookers in Want to Make a Difference Menu Homepage Info Product News Cookers in use Want to Make a Difference Homepage Info Product News Cookers in Want to Make a Difference Challenge in Africa 840 million people in sub-Saharan Africa don’t have access to electricity. 700 million people are projected to remain without access to electricity by 2050 due to rapid population growth. An open fire is highly energy inefficient and requires a lot of wood. Family of 5 consumes 4000 kg of wood a year producing 6400 kg of CO2. An open fire produces massive air.lution with many dangerous pollutants that penetrate deep into the lungs. Indoor Inlution causes 4 million prem. deaths a year and diseases incl. pneumonia and chronic obstruc. pulmonary disease. Women in developing countries spend an average of 1.4 hours a day collecting firewood and 4 hours cooking. Women are heavily affected by indoor pollutions. Millions of children do not attend or complete primary education - Majority are girls who stay at home to do. labor. Fa ies in suburban areas a big part of their annual income on buying charcoal and lamp oil Unsustainable harvesting of firewood drives deforestation and forest degradation. High rates of deforestation causes: land ero., desertification, famine, destruction of animal habitat andooooding. Deforestation also forces people to leave their homes in search of better opportunities – in Europe and neighbouring countries. Women no longer need to burn wood on an open fire for cooking. Indoor air will be clean and health of those exposed to the fire will be improved. Trees continue to a.orb CO2 from the atmosphere and produce other crucial ecosystem services. Afstor Solar Cooker reduces CO2 emissions equal to 260 000 km driven by a car or 10 Helsinki-Tokio ro. trips by planet during five years. Buyer of Afstor Solar Cooker can track its usage rate and the reduction of CO2 emissions on a website. Afstor Solar Cooker reduces workload, creating more time for studying and productive activities with higher returns for women and children who no longer need to waste time on collecting firewood. Finns invent how to save Africa’s forests – in the Sambian village they no longer collect trees to burn but plant them – AfstorOy There are about 600 million people in Africa who cook their food with wood. The combustion tree causes forest destruction, desertification and carbon dioxide emissions – which accelerates climate change. Consequently, the use of firewood in its food plant is one of the biggest problems in Africa and the world. The Finnish company Afstor believes it has found the best solution to the problem. Lappeenranta Series Entrepreneur and Inventor Ari Biispanen, together with Jero Arola, Professor of Energy Efficiency at Lappeenranta-Lahti University of Technology, has developed a solar-.ric kitchen, which they hope to reduce the use of firewood in society. Unboxing the AG. Biotech Container The AG. Biotech set-up is simple: Wastewater goes in, and water comes out, and between these there is the algae bioreactor and the biomass harvester. The trick is in the know-. and the clever system running the whole thing. Growth conditions are optimized in the artificial environment of our bioreactors. This allows for considerably higher growth and purity levels than in natural conditions. Biomass quality in various algae products can be optimized. In to run the process, the system keeps track of costs such as heat, electricity and nutrients to make mourn the output yields more than the input takes. Our system is all-in-one and scalable. The process requires carbon dioxide, nitrogen oxides, nutrients, and heating the wastewater that goes in. The purified water can be reused, even as drinking water. The system also produces dry algal biomass, assuming algae have a carbon mass fraction of 50%. Biomass is harvested once a month with an average yield of 50 kg. Sochi 2014 Winter Olympics Plus temperaturemaking by the SnowGen system from Finnish SnowTek The SnowGen all-weather mobile artificial snow machines are made by the Finnish company SnowTek. The SnowTekensures the snowmaking of the ski jumping and Nordic combined competition venue of the Winter Olympics in Sochi, 2014. The SnowGen-system has already been producing snow in Sochi in up to more than 20°C outdoor temperature. SnowTek ensures that in the demanding conditions of Sochi there will be enough snow. The venue of the ski jumping and the Nordic combined is locating at lower elevations where the snow situation varies greatly each year. The snow produced by the SnowGen-system has been tested. The snow is solid and firm and it lasts very well in the heat and in the sun. The snow has been successful, even though the temperature has been up to more than 30°C in the Sun. In the ski test, the snow was good for skiing when the temperature was in the shadow of + 15°C and in the sun up to more than + 30°C. The night-time temperature falling to about + 6 to + 8 degrees. This was stated by Mikko Martikainen from Snow Secure Oy, who has made “Sochi 2014 Snow” – the snowbackup plan for the Sochi Winter Olympics Organizing Committee. The SnowGen system includes advanced technology, comprising three individual units. Refrigeration is unique and no harmful chemicals are used in the snowmaking process. The system has a capacity of 200.3/24, or a total of 600. 3/24h; it is also possible to get smaller capacity systems. SnowGen is a mobile system that is. of large snowmaking capacity. The units are transportable by two tr.s and the erection and start-up of the whole entirety is accomplished in one day. In the hardware development work Canadian IceGen Inc., producer of ice slurry generators. For more information contact: Ha. Pesonen SnowTek gsm: +358 400 mail1901 e-mail: SnowTek specializes in management systems of all-weather snowmaking and indoor winter conditions - such as winter adventure areas, indoor skiing halls and ice rinks. Our services include concept design, equipment - refrigeration, air conditioning, track cooling, indoor snowmaking and installation. SnowTek has over 30 years of experience in the industry. We are part of the AMADA Group, which consists of more than 100 companies across five continents, and more than 9000 employees of which 2,000 are situated in Europe. The Group’s Head..ers are in Isehara, Japan. AMADA was founded in 1946 and is today one of the world’s leading manufacturers of high-technology metal working machinery, such as bending machines, punch presses and laser cutting machines. At AAE we develop and manufacture automation solutions for the group’s metal working machinery. Most of our equipment is exported, with Europe and North America being our main markets. We employ more than 200 people, and our head office is situated in Bennäs. Greg Seymour is our Managing Director. Values Our values define the kind of people we are and how we act professionally – now and in the future. Openness: In Communication and Attitude Accountability; for the results and quality of own work Dedication; is the driving force Profes.alism secured through openness, accountability, and dedication. Quality and Safety AMADA Automation Europe’s management system is certified against the ISO standards ISO 9001:2015 (Quality), ISO 14001 (Environmental) and ISO 45001 (Occupational Health and Safety). AAE Business Strategy While ensureiving to Ensure the AMADA Group we will develop the business without jeopardizing the ability of future generations to satisfy their needs. Our actions must promote a balance between Social, Economic and Ecological Sustainability: Safety – an important indicator we believe that Occupational Health and Safety is an important indicator. Our vision is that everyone should be able to work and. healthy. This is achieved by continuously and systematically improving an already and secure working environment. It is the basisss of all our operations. Careers We want our success to our employees as well as our customers, business partners and the local community. This philosophy permeates the way we develop both our workplace and company culture, as well as our smart and user-..ion solutions. At AAE you get the best of both worlds – a workplace with a clear connection to the local community, where you, at the same time, can take part of the development opportunities offered by a global group such as AMADA. It is important for us to be a workplace where every employee feels valued and that all of us can grow and develop together with the company. All of this is summarized in our motto: Making sense together. Are you interested in joining our team? Open positions can be found on our career page. If you don’t find a position, you can send us an open application through our Talent Community. The application period for summer jobs has ended. Move to Content Stö Values Quality and Safety Recruitment AMADA subsections Svenska English Language Notification Procedure SKROLLAA We want to protect and encourage employees or other stakehons to report potential violations, misconduct or illegal activity in an organization without fear of retaliation. The procedure is based on our values (openness, accountability and commitment) and promotes a healthy, transparent culture and prevents cor.tion and abuse. Who can be a reporter? It may be an employee, en employee, trainer, supplier, customer or other stakeho.s of AAE. To make an internal and external announcement in the In. Notice, the notifier nostaas an inappropriate behavior or activity of any organization. In the external notice, the notifier kanssas an inappropriate behaviour or activity within an organisation with the competent authority. What is stated in the announcement? The report may indicate suspected violations or errors that violate the law. Personal dissatisfaction or complaint is not a matter of notice, but is taken into consideration with the supervisor or HR department as usual. Notification procedure We want a company culture where employees can openly report their needs and events that can cause problems for employees, managers and management. However, if it feels uncomfortable to report directly to an organization, for example, because of the fear of consequences, we have a separate reporting process in which the identity of the reporter is protected under the aforementioned Declarant Protection Act. To make the notification so that the identity is protected in AAE, the CFO Örjan Räikkönen and HR and Communications Coordinator Stina Åvist are responsible for the processing of the notifications received. Only they have the right to process notices and they are obliged to keep the declarant’s identity secret if they know who sent the notice. We ensure full protection for notifications inennce with applicable laws, regulations and regulations. We agree not to take any countermeasures against any person who made the announcement. The notification of the breach may also be submitted via the "intermediary" which is then obliged to provide the notice immediately to the reporting processors, see above. The intermediary shall also be subject to the confidentiality and shall not disclose the identity of the reporter without his consent. The notification shall be made in good faith and shall contain as detailed as possible a description of the alleged conduct, relevant individuals, as well as the grounds and any evidence for claims. If possible, documents supporting the claim must also be submitted. The notification is always handled confidentially. Notification channels The notification may be made either in writing or orally, by e-mail, telephone or at the request of the notifier at an agreed meeting (physical or online meeting). A letter sent in the mail addressed personally to someone in the company is also possible. Email: (received byÖt Örjan Räikkönen and Stina Åvist) Phone: Örjan Räikkönen 050 3798 296, Stina Åvist 040 Åite 352 Address: AMADA AUTOMATION EUROPE Stina Åvist, Svartnäshagantie 7, 68910 The Confirmation Pron for receipt of the Notice shall be issued within seven days. Pro.ors shall take the necessary measures to determine the accuracy of the notice and, if necessary, to interfere with the breach. The Saarivals will be forwarded to the company if necessary. If the notice concerns a person in charge, the matter will be discussed with the government or the owners. Within three months of confirmation the person shall be informed of the measures taken on the basis of the notification. The notification shall be kept for 12 months after the person has received the notification of the measures taken. The notifier may contact the competent authority (making an external notification) if he has reasonable grounds to believe that the internal declaration has not led to action on the basis of the above-mentioned period of notification, it is not possible to effectively interfere with an infringement or that he or she is at risk of being subjected to countermeasures due to the notification. Communications This reporting procedure is available on the company’s website and in the company’s internal document processing system. The notification procedure and practices related to the notification channel shall be communicated to all managers, supervisors and employees. The reporting procedure is included in the study of new measures. The purity requirements of production often require multi-stage washing solutions, in which case the pieces are detergent for collection or painting. If the washable pieces are encased or otherwise challenging in the drill, the washing machine can be equipped with an indoor washing system. The finishing after the washing process can be carried out with warm air blowing or hot circular drying, which is ready for the next phase. Service operations often require excellent preparedness before maintenance or repair work. Often a single-stage washing is enough, but pre-washing may be a good option for the washing process. The washing machines can be equipped with a hand washing unit, allowing them to be pre-washed safely inside the cha. before the actual washing process begins. here here the same hot washing fluid is used in prewashing as in the actual washing process, in which case the washing fluid is filtered through the washing machine filtering technology. A hand washing unit can replace a separate pressure washing place. Ultrasound washing is a common choice in the metal and electronics industry, food and health care sectors, and laboratories – in many cases it is even a superior or only washing solution. It is an efficient, accurate and environmentally . washing method. We will be happy to help with the selection of equipment and other questions about ultrasound laundering. And ask more! What is ultrasound la?ry? Ultrasound washing is an effective way to remove various pollutants such as rasva and other common impurities. Washing does not damage the pieces, so it can be used in a variety of different materials and components. The advantage of ultrasound is that it can wash even the complex objects that many other technologies have very difficult or even impossible to wash. Ultrasound can be washed with: Different instruments, such as Electronic Aircraft Parts of Space Technology Food industry equipment Glossed surfaces of Hydraulics How does ultrasound work? Ultrasonic washing occurs by conducting an ultrasound in the washing fluid with a fre.ency of 25-130 kHz. This creates an ultrasound washing cavitation, resulting in small bubbles on the surface of the objects in the washing fluid, causing pressure in the washing body. Pressure attacks effectively remove rasva and dirty pieces. The washing fluid can be just water, but with a combination of washing and heating (about 30-80°C) and fre.ency fluctuations, a better result is achieved. Ultrasonic washing is also suitable for hard-to-clean parts (such as hydraulic blocks), cleaning even the smallest holes and cavities. Ultrasonic washing is efficient, environmentally . and functional. What makes ultrasound so good? Ultrasonic washing is a water-based and energy-efficient washing method for environmentally a washing. Method to effectively eliminate pollutants from difficult sites, clean all surfaces to which the washing fluid can penetrate. Works with many chemicals Want to read more about our blog? Read the Tierra Tech ultrasound washing machine. TierraTech ultrasound washing machine TierraTech is the world’s leading ultrasound washing machine manufacturer. There are best selections from the quality of the table to large pool solutions. The machines are manufactured in Spain by more than 20 years of experience. Elma Schmidbauer GmbH manufactures high-quality and low-quality ultrasound cleaners with over 60 years of experience. The efficiency of the washing machine was increased by a two-door solution enabling cross-driving and a T-rail system located on the front door. https://www.aquapartners.fi/.https://www.aquapartners.fi/#h.p_xBkwbo_: Aqua Partners Search this site Skip to main content Skip to navigation Aqua Partners FOR FASTER RECOVERY AQUAPARTNET Releases Clearances in Religious Accounts A compact-sized cold water pool with no large space-consuming technology - Easy to use and maintain – cost-effective No strong chemicals, including sensitive skin Regular refrigeration Accelerate muscle recovery Relieves pain caused by injuries and diseases Increased joint mobility Increases mood and increases energeticity, FC Inter players regularly use a cold water pool, the story of AquaP.ners has begun from the Veritas Stadion dressing room, where the first cold water pool was chosen two years ago. FC Inter now plays for the championship and uses cold water regularly. Ville Peltonen, Physiotherapist at FC Inter, said the team players use the cold pool as a returning day after the game as part of the exact return protocol. The goal of using a cold pool is to mitigate delayed muscular activity, and players have many positive experiences. Players’ own feelings are monitored by various survey meters, from which physiotherapists and physicists receive numerical feedback directly from the player’s power. Sometimes a cold pool can be used as a treatment after a shocking hit below. “The impact mechanisms for cooling water treatment are not yet known, but I feel the use of the cold pool as an important part of a holistic recovery alongside other measures,” Peltonen adds. https://www.aquapartners.fi/.https://www.aquapartners.fi/koti: Aqua Partners Search this site Skip to main content Skip to navigation Aqua Partners FOR FASTER RECOVERY AQUAPARTNET Releases Clearances in Religious Accounts A compact-sized cold water pool with no large space-consuming technology - Easy to use and maintain – cost-effective No strong chemicals, including sensitive skin Regular refrigeration Accelerate muscle recovery Relieves pain caused by injuries and diseases Increased joint mobility Increases mood and increases energeticity, FC Inter players regularly use a cold water pool, the story of AquaP.ners has begun from the Veritas Stadion dressing room, where the first cold water pool was chosen two years ago. FC Inter now plays for the championship and uses cold water regularly. Ville Peltonen, Physiotherapist at FC Inter, said the team players use the cold pool as a returning day after the game as part of the exact return protocol. The goal of using a cold pool is to mitigate delayed muscular activity, and players have many positive experiences. Players’ own feelings are monitored by various survey meters, from which physiotherapists and physicists receive numerical feedback directly from the player’s power. Sometimes a cold pool can be used as a treatment after a shocking hit below. “The impact mechanisms for cooling water treatment are not yet known, but I feel the use of the cold pool as an important part of a holistic recovery alongside other measures,” Peltonen adds. The materials and design professionals in the Artekno Design department are helping our customers at every step: from a good idea to a great product. already in the initial stages Good design saves time and gets ready products faster. In the early stages of design, we can influence the sustainability, design and production efficiency of the product. The innovative solutions for materials and design are Artek’s everyday life. You will get access to the necessary expertise and modern solutions to support your design or you can outsource the design completely to us. Our strength is part of your success. The Right Certified Technology The Artekno Design team has extensive experience in the behaviour of different materials at different stages of the process. This knowledge has been used successfully in thousands of projects. We select optimum technology and material for the purpose of the product, as well as for productivity. We take into account, for example, the life cycle of the product, the planned production volume and the potential versions of the product to be effectively prepared. Take advantage of our knowledge. Together with material manufacturers, Artekno develops more environmentally . solutions for the benefit of all of us. We have introduced products from recycled EPP materials such as Ocean 35. They use recycled materials collected from sea and ropes. The travel thermometers are made of corn-based industrially grounded Biovia. We aim to utilize low-en.y processes and low-en.y energia to eliminate as little carbon footprint as possible. Properly designed products last a long time and bring joy to their users. “Analysis of the product’s operating environment, assessment of production volumes and selection of suitable manufacturing methods are: a key role in success. All of this is helpful.” Jesse Paloniemi, Designer, Artekno Design Ask Anything! Artekno Design knows When you have an idea, ask us how to do it. We’ll help you with the idea, product development and product design – all the way to logistics. Leave a message from the plan to prototype We manufacture a prototype from a mea.able product to test the functionality of the solution and find development targets. Manufacture of prototype Order the Planning Manual Are you an industrial designer or product designer? We have produced a manual for design that helps with the selection of materials and technologies. Order a free manual by providing your email address. You can also request planning assistance from the Artekno Design team. e-mails * Artekno is involved from the very beginning – a joint product development starts with the design of the fashion, Artekno polyurethane products have been developed in all Veikkaus. machines. Our first report is a step towards a more open and responsible future. The main focus areas of our sustainability report are environmental and social responsibility. The First Artekno the report is based on the values and results of 2022. In 2023, Artekno Oy made significant investments. Heating from natural gas to kau heating produced more than 95% of renewable raw materials. We also exchanged electricity for renewable energy. We have reduced the use of fossil fuels significantly, re.cing fuel oil with liquid gas. Reducing the carbon footprint. Our investment in emissions-free energy and kau heating will result in an annual reduction in carbon dioxide emissions of 820 tonnes. We continue to work to further reduce our carbon footprint. Our processes are becoming more environmentally .. Improving the recycling rate of fiber packaging, renewable materials and plastics contributes to the circular economy and is a prerequisite for the achievement of environmental objectives. In order to meet our goals, Artekno has joined forces with Ecovadis, the company that conducts sustainability assessments for international companies. Ecovadis’s collaboration allows us to see where we are strong and where we can improve our operations. Learn about this and the accountability report: Artekno Sustainability Report We will continue to work to improve responsibility.
